chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The &smtool; (⪪) for &sle; &productnumber; allows enterprise customers to optimize the management of &sle; software updates and subscription entitlements. It establishes a proxy system for &sccreg; with repositories and registration targets. This helps you to centrally manage software updates within a firewall on a per-system basis, while maintaining your corporate security policies and regulatory compliance.

&ismt; allows you to provision updates for all of your devices running a product based on &sle;. By downloading these updates once and distributing them throughout the enterprise, you can set more restrictive firewall policies. This also reduces bandwidth usage, as there is no need to download the same updates for each device. ⪪ is fully supported and available as a download for customers with an active &sle; product subscription.
&smtool; provides functionality that can be useful in many situations, including the following:

listitem.para: Not all machines in your environment can be connected to &scc; to register and retrieve updates for bandwidth or security reasons.
There are &sle; hosts that are restricted and difficult to update without putting in place a custom update management solution.
You need to integrate additional external or internal repositories.

important.title: Client Migration from &slea; 12 to 15
important.para: Starting with &slea; 15, ⪪ was replaced by &rmt;. If you are planning to migrate &slea; 12 clients to version 15, &rmt; is the supported product to handle such migrations. If you still need to use ⪪ for these migrations, beware that the migrated clients will have all installation modules enabled.
For a feature comparison between &rmt; and ⪪, see .
